was that a g++ or a bash error? :)
anyway, C++ programs are compiled with g++; install build-essential and you're fine :)
the command is g++ source.file -o name_of_output_executable
try with that and your program will compile
: wt shud i put in place of name_of_output_executable ?
gimme an example..suppose my source file is abc.cpp..shud i try the followin : g++ abc.cpp -o abc.exe ?
though usually you don't add .exe to executable names in Linux
if you don't specify the -o option, the default filename will be "a.out"
